On this page

Development â€‹

Want to contribute or run locally? Here's how.

What you need â€‹

  • Node.js 18+
  • Docker & Docker Compose
  • Git

Setup â€‹

bash
git clone https://github.com/Ketbome/minepanel.git
cd minepanel
1
2

Project structure â€‹

minepanel/
â”œâ”€â”€ backend/          # NestJS API
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auth/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ server-management/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ discord/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ system-monitoring/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ docker-compose/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ settings/
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ users/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ test/
â”œâ”€â”€ frontend/         # Next.js UI
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ app/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ components/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lib/
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ services/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ public/
â””â”€â”€ doc/             # VitePress docs

Run locally â€‹

Backend â€‹

bash
cd backend
npm install
npm run start:dev
1
2
3

Runs on http://localhost:8091

Frontend â€‹

bash
cd frontend
npm install
npm run dev
1
2
3

Runs on http://localhost:3000

Environment files â€‹

backend/.env:

bash
FRONTEND_URL= 'http://localhost:3000' # URL of the frontend application
# Generate a strong random secret: openssl rand -base64 32
JWT_SECRET= # Example: your-super-secret-jwt-key-change-this-in-production
CLIENT_PASSWORD= # Password for client
CLIENT_USERNAME= # Username for the client
DB_PATH=./data/minepanel.db
BASE_DIR=.
1
2
3
4
5
6
7
8

frontend/.env:

bash
NEXT_PUBLIC_BACKEND_URL='http://localhost:8091' # URL of the backend API, it's important start with http:// or https://
NEXT_PUBLIC_DEFAULT_LANGUAGE=en # es or en
1
2

Tech stack â€‹

Backend â€‹

  • NestJS
  • TypeORM + SQLite (sql.js)
  • Docker API
  • Passport JWT

Frontend â€‹

  • Next.js 14 (App Router)
  • React
  • TailwindCSS
  • shadcn/ui

Build for production â€‹

bash
# Build image
docker build -t minepanel:local .

# Run it
docker compose up -d
1
2
3
4
5

Contributing â€‹

Check CONTRIBUTING.md

Quick version â€‹

  1. Fork the repo
  2. Create a branch: git checkout -b feature/thing
  3. Make changes
  4. Test: npm test
  5. Lint: npm run lint
  6. Push and open PR

Commit format â€‹

feat(server): add Purpur support
fix(ui): button alignment
docs: update install guide
1
2
3

Code style â€‹

  • Use TypeScript
  • Follow ESLint rules
  • Write meaningful variable names
  • Keep functions small
  • Add comments for complex logic

Testing â€‹

bash
# Backend
cd backend && npm test

# Frontend
cd frontend && npm test
1
2
3
4
5

Documentation â€‹

Docs are in doc/ using VitePress.

bash
cd doc
npm install
npm run docs:dev
1
2
3

Runs on http://localhost:5173

Common tasks â€‹

Add a new server type â€‹

  1. Add to backend/src/docker-compose/docker-compose.service.ts
  2. Add to frontend dropdown
  3. Test it

Add a translation â€‹

  1. Create frontend/src/lib/translations/[lang].ts
  2. Copy from en.ts and translate
  3. Register in index.ts
  4. Test it

Debug â€‹

Backend:

bash
npm run start:debug
1

Frontend:

bash
# Check browser console
# Check Network tab
1
2

Logs:

bash
docker compose logs -f minepanel
1

Troubleshooting â€‹

Port already in use â€‹

Change ports in .env or docker-compose

Docker permission errors â€‹

bash
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
# Log out and back in
1
2

Node modules issues â€‹

bash
rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json
npm install
1
2

Release process â€‹

  1. Update version in package.json
  2. Update CHANGELOG
  3. Create git tag
  4. Push to main
  5. GitHub Actions builds and pushes to Docker Hub

Need help? â€‹

  • GitHub Discussions
  • Issues
  • FAQ
